Hi Jim,

You're welcome. Maybe soon we can have katakana on our fittings 
k=
anteisho!! Since this information didn't go out on this list, let me 
add t=
hat kenkyu-in is the first step to becoming a member of the shinsa 
team. A=
ll of the members of the present team went through the ranks. 
The next ste=
p is shinsa-in hosa, which means an assistant to the shinsa 
team. Assistan=
ts should fill out the working papers -- in Japanese. I 
could somewhat man=
age this, but in the end, I was given a break. The 
third stage is full shi=
nsa team member. This all typically takes about 
four years or so from kenk=
yu-in to full shinsa team member.

I will also try and scan a photo of Chos=
hu-ya's koshirae. I don't think 
it sold.

On 2003.11.8, at 02:54  PM, Jim =
Gilbert wrote:

> Gordon,
> I suspect that there may be iron tsunagi in som=
e of those koshirae.=A0

ne saku, Nanbokucho 
> blade" was the one that was I was going on about.=A0=
 The "younger" one 
> is pretty interesting, too.=A0 I wish I had seen Chos=
hu-ya's koshirae, 
> but I'd like to have seen a complete example of the ol=
der one even 
> more.=A0 But, I stayed home instead.
>

from Ian on the yahoo nihonto list of your public 
> mention of the kenkyu-=
in thing there.=A0 Thanks for the recognition.=A0 I

o do.
>
> Jim

lutely killer. I wonder why the Tegai Kanenaga inside is
